message_1: What is the chemical equation for the precipitation reaction that occurs when solutions of barium chloride and sodium sulfate are mixed?
message_2:
When solutions of barium chloride (BaCl2) and sodium sulfate (Na2SO4) are mixed, a precipitation reaction occurs, forming solid barium sulfate (BaSO4) and aqueous sodium chloride (NaCl). The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

BaCl2(aq) + Na2SO4(aq) â†’ BaSO4(s) + 2NaCl(aq)
